intro: Fumaria parviflora var. leucantha, commonly known as the white-crown fumitory, is a herbaceous annual plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, pale yellow flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. Its delicate appearance and historical use in traditional medicine make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
